docs.snippet: Long-term investment, however, might be tamped down as businesses wait to see how policy might change under a new administration, experts said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Long-term investment, however, might be tamped down as businesses wait to see how policy might change under a new administration, experts said.
docs.abstract: Companies across range of industries are blaming upcoming presidential election for business downturns; economists say there is no real evidence impending election affects consumer spending but assert government policy shapes firms' long-term investment decisions; working paper by University of Chicago economics professor Tarek Alexander Hassan finds that the more executives talk about political risks the more likely they are to cut back on hiring and investment.

headline.main: The Election’s Effect on the Economy? Doughnut Sales Are Probably Safe
headline.print_headline: Sales Down? Hiring Slow? Let’s All Blame the Election

docs.snippet: Billionaire technology investor Peter Thiel, a lightning rod for criticism in Silicon Valley for his support of Donald Trump, predicted on Monday that the movement the Republican presidential nominee has created would carry on even if he loses his...
docs.lead_paragraph: Billionaire technology investor Peter Thiel, a lightning rod for criticism in Silicon Valley for his support of Donald Trump, predicted on Monday that the movement the Republican presidential nominee has created would carry on even if he loses his bid for the White House on Nov. 8.

headline.main: Tech Billionaire Thiel Says Trump Movement 'Not Going Away'
headline.print_headline: Tech Billionaire Thiel Says Trump Movement 'Not Going Away'

docs.snippet: U.S. Attorney General Loretta Lynch did not order FBI Director James Comey to withhold from Congress the discovery of emails potentially related to the investigation into Hillary Clinton's email server, but she made it known that she thought his d...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Attorney General Loretta Lynch did not order FBI Director James Comey to withhold from Congress the discovery of emails potentially related to the investigation into Hillary Clinton's email server, but she made it known that she thought his decision violated department policy, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

headline.main: U.S. Attorney General Did Not Order FBI to Withhold Clinton-Related Emails: Source
headline.print_headline: U.S. Attorney General Did Not Order FBI to Withhold Clinton-Related Emails: Source

docs.snippet: Investors in Asia bought the Japanese yen, sold South Korean stocks and stayed away from volatile assets on Monday, reacting to opinion polls showing Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton's lead over her Republican rival Donald Trump narrowing furt...
docs.lead_paragraph: Investors in Asia bought the Japanese yen, sold South Korean stocks and stayed away from volatile assets on Monday, reacting to opinion polls showing Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton's lead over her Republican rival Donald Trump narrowing further in the U.S. presidential election.

headline.main: Investors Buy Yen, Shun Risk in Asia as Clinton Losing Edge in U.S. Polls
headline.print_headline: Investors Buy Yen, Shun Risk in Asia as Clinton Losing Edge in U.S. Polls
